creditline: Gift of Ruth and Bruce Dayton
description: 3 bulbous sections at bottom with 3 thin legs; 2 u-shaped handles; incised geometric designs on exterior bulbous sections
text: This three-lobed vessel is cast in flat relief with three <I>t'ao-tieh<I> masks comprising the chief decoration. The tripod is a good example of a Shang bronze ritual vessel whose basic shape evolved from Neolithic and early Bronze Age ceramics like the one shown to the right.
title: Tripod Ritual Vessel
